justification: “Higher scores on the Cognitive Reflection Test (CRT), which measures the degree to which people use analytical reasoning to overcome intuitive but incorrect responses…”

“Of the three subscales on this measure, having faith in one's intuitive feelings… are associated with stronger endorsement of conspiracy theories, poorer accuracy discernment, and greater willingness to share false information.”
“Of the three subscales on this measure… believing that truth is political (i.e., defined by those in power) is associated with… greater willingness to share false information.”
“Requiring evidence as a basis for beliefs is associated with reduced willingness to share false content, less endorsement of conspiracy theories, and better accuracy discernment.”

justification: “We computed the difference in the amount shared… in the dictator game, as well as the difference between in-party vs out-party feeling thermometer ratings… the final measure of affective polarization was the participant's average Z-score across the two measures.”
“Participants then completed… the MIST-20 headline accuracy judgment measure (40).”
